column5: couldnt take it any longer,  after 68 long days of garage hibernation, the boat got wet again - found a usable launch & fired things up for another softwater season  was a tough go, but near the end of the day we avoided the skunk with this red-cheeker    a few more weeks of trout before the salmon arrive ( water temps pending of course)

nice Bow...about the same size as the one I got today in a boat on the Niagara, was a passenger ...LOL.  Was very very slow today, only seen 1 other fished hooked and there was like 20 - 25 boats out there
great to see guys fishing softwater
WTG Mark...yes, it's nice to be on water in the liquid form.
Congrats Mark!  Whopper
Way to go.Seeing that picture makes me want to go out and untarp the boat.

First....... How you doing there Bud? Stupid statement considering you were out on the water,  But......!!!!!!!!????????? Glad to see you got the boat out and even picked up on some action,  exellent colours on that fish Mark. I'll have to go back and do a double take on that pic.........didnt notice if you got your motor cover back or not. Take care friend.... -peter
Sweet!!!  What a beauty fish Mark.  Way to go.  Joey
Drool............  Nice going!
very nice fish!  I gotta admit I'm really starting to get the itch, how much longer to musky opener?
I didn`t notice the fish just how foggy it was out there.
I'm beginning to look like a crack phene with the Itch I got going.  Nice colors on that beauty.
Hallelujah!  The winter is almost over!
well done.  ..and man it must have felt real good to get out in nthe boat so early in the season....i cant wait maybe in a week or 2 then im ready to go.  ...man i hate cabin fever....  .
Great looking fish, Congrats and let the softwater season begin.
Beautiful!  Nice to see a boat and open water in a picture again also!  Lucky you!   Bly
Well, my bud and I drilled almost 30 holes with my auger today, ice was 3 ft. thick, I think its gonna be a bit for us to hit open water lol Good going fishdawg.
WTG Mark.  Nice looking fish.
Nice fish Mark
Mark....you need to cut down on your oil mixture!!!  NICE fish bud !
